item.title: A concurrent resolution supporting the goals and ideals of the designation of the year of 2011 as the International Year for People of African Descent.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S1145)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S1145)

item.name: Rule of law and government transparency

summary.text:
Supports the designation of 2011 as the International Year for People of African Descent.

Reaffirms the full and equal participation of people of African descent around the world in all aspects of political, economic, social, and cultural life.

Supports efforts to promote democracy, human rights, the rule of law, and the eradication of poverty, hunger, inequality, and social exclusion.

Reaffirms the commitment of Congress to address racism, discrimination, and intolerance in the United States and around the globe.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution supporting the goals and ideals of the designation of the year of 2011 as the International Year for People of African Descent.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
